articles.title: Short Video of William Ruto Bragging about Talanta Stadium Sparks Reactions: "Hii Ni Noma Sana"
articles.source: Breaking NEWS in KENYA for Today Right Now & Kenyan News | TUKO
articles.description: President William Ruto laughed at critics who did not believe he could actualise the Talanta Stadium. He shared a video showing the progress, sparking reactions.
articles.content:
• During the 2025 Jamhuri celebrations, Governor Johnson Sakaja pleaded with President William Ruto to rename Talanta Stadium after the late Raila Odinga

articles.author: Amondi Aroko

articles.title: Gov't moves to boost farm mechanisation as New Holland opens new facility in Kenya
articles.description: The Kenyan government has stepped up efforts to promote farm mechanisation as New Holland Agriculture opened a new facility in Nairobi, part of a public-private partnership aimed at modernising the country’s largely manual farming sector

articles.title: Kenya Bankers Association calls for 5% salary tax reduction to boost households
articles.description: Kenya Bankers Association has welcomed the move by the National Treasury to adopt a tax exemption for Kenyans earning Ksh.30,000 and below.
articles.content:
Kenya Bankers Association has welcomed the move by the National Treasury to adopt a tax exemption for Kenyans earning Ksh.30,000 and below.

articles.title: Relief for Kenyan exporters as Trump signs AGOA extension into law
articles.description: It is a sigh of relief for the country's multi-billion shilling textile and manufacturing industry as the African Growth and Opportunity Act, AGOA, gets a new lease on life.

articles.title: KRA to launch digital staff management system to boost service delivery, enhance transparency
articles.description: The Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA) is set to roll out the Staff Management System to oversee how its officers work with the public, in a shift aimed at speeding up assistance, tightening oversight, and building trust with taxpayers.

articles.title: AGOA: New lease of life for US-Africa trade accord
articles.description: AGOA which has been renewed until the end of 2026, has provided duty-free access to the US for certain African products since 2000.
articles.content:
